Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: den1401
Reviews.Content: great hotel to stay in near under ground station, just at the end of the road. close to a few bars that had entertainment in the evening. 10 mins from central Berlin on the under ground. Brilliant city to get around, can pay by zone, so easy to get a ticket that lasts all day and covers trains, trams, buses and underground. We went up the tower what a view, also went to the zoo and aquarium, as we went in January we had wrapped up well, would like to go back in warmer weather.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: WalsallPumpkin2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days in January. Hotel is great and excellent value in a nice quiet part of Berlin. Underground just two minutes walk and you can get anywhere from here. Excellent Greek restaurant across the road which is nearest one to hotel and very good value and busy which is a good sign. Breakfast ok usual continental stuff and eggs bacon etc. We had a great time despite the cold weather which we went prepared for!! I did want it to snow but never happened!! There was a fridge in the room which contained minibar but we stocked our cheap wine in from supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “3 day break in berlin”
Reviews.Author: juesysch
Reviews.Content: good location just a couple of stops on the train to the centre, hotel staff very friendly, room very comfortable and clean, wouldnt say it was 4 star though, but good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore a great city”
Reviews.Author: Euroscrote
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel as part of a special offer advertised on Travelzoo and it was fantastic value for money. We stayed for three nights and could have done with more time to see all that Berlin has to offer. The hotel is just outside the ity centre in a very pleasant residential district. I even saw a red squirrel crossing the street outside on my last day. In spite of this relative tranquility there are good local shops and even a currywurst stall close by in case you need a quick snack/fix of this delicious Berlin delicacy. The hotel does not do lunch or evening meals but does do an excellent breakfast buffet. The receptionists recommended the Wirtshaus zum Nussbaum 15 minutes walk or two Metro stops away at the Bundesplatz for traditional German food in the evening. It was so good we ate there on two of our three nights but you need to take a hearty appetite as portions are more than generous. The Metro is two minutes walk from the hotel and links you into the very good public transport system. The Kurfurstendamm with its shops and tour buses is two stops away. There is no airport shuttle but you can getthere on public transport (S and U Bahn) from Schonefeld with a couple of changes and at a cost of a few Euros with a day or Welcome ticket. Certainly puts the rip-off prices charged byt train operators for the London airport "expresses" into perspective. Rooms were clean and comfortable and service efficient and pleasant. All in all a very pleasant stay for a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable solo stay but nothing special...”
Reviews.Author: mrvanp
Reviews.Content: When I've stayed in another city I do typically look for a hotel that is a brand name of 3 star quality or better and is outside of the centre of town (15 minutes by U-Bahn from Zoo Station and maybe about 30 from Potsdamer Platz in this case). Basically this hotel ticks the box for all of the above but I wouldn't say that it is any better than average as an overall experience. I would have no issues with staying here again (if/when I go back to Berlin) but I would also look around first Staff: All of them were very bi-lingual and spoke good English (to the point where they couldn't understand why I bothered to speak German but tolerated the fact that I was keen to improve my own language skills). In fairness I didn't ask anything about the local area so I don't know what they would have been like in that respect. Room: Single Room/Non-Smoking with standard Best Western fittings. It wasn't unclean or obviously worn but you could see it had been while since the last re-fit (the last Best Western I'd stayed in had only been refitted in the last 6 months so the difference was obvious). Key point: if you are offered the quite side of the hotel there is a charge for this (I didn't ask what the charge was when offered it so accept that it was a 50/50 as I'd accepted it and didn't complain) and had a 40 euro addition to my bill when checking out. Other issue is that there are no safes in the rooms but a deposit box option at the front desk which was fine and easy to use (I believe this is to do with German laws on liability so may be consistent elsewhere). Hotel: As above the facilities and fixings were fine and nothing to complain about. My brochure listed it as a 4* but I would say it is probably closer to a 3*+. The lifts weren't exactly fast but were no different to any other hotels I've stayed in. Breakfast: was fine and was the standard Best Western deal, with a few tweaks. Point of note the croissants didn't seem to get replaced (virtually everything else did) and I wasn't exactly late down for Breakfast but only got a couple on the last day (it seems like they were very popular with the Germans). Sleep: I slept no differently to what I do at home so I can only class this as average (I usually tend to sleep in a touch later in hotels). Was unimpressed with what ever woke me up on Tuesday at 7:00am (there was a conference room on my floor but there was the possibility that it was something outside so I can't mark this down). Location: Is outside of the centre of town so it met my requirements but it may not be ideal for others (the U-Bahn is 100 metres from the hotel which will get you to the heart of the city within 30 minutes). Make sure you take the front of the U9 train when heading towards the Rathaus Stiglitz and the back when heading towards Osloer Strasse or otherwise you will come out of the wrong exit that will put you at the wrong end of the block (you want to head towards the ADAC building). Value: was good considering what you got for it, on reflection I wouldn't have taken the quiet room upgrade as I don't think that there would have been much benefit. Stay: September 2011 Time: 4 Nights B&B (excluding sleep I was probably in the Hotel for only 3-4 hours per day) Room: Solo, Non-Smoking on the quiet side of the Hotel

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel nice area”
Reviews.Author: lindyloo6
Reviews.Content: stayed here for the Christmas markets, the hotel is in Wilmersdorf area which is a nice area with lots of shops to explore. If you stand outside the hotel and walk right there are various bars and good cafe's to explore and I found alot of the shops for things like handbags ect to be cheaper than in other area's of Berlin. The hotel itself has a small reception area with the bar next to it, nice friendly atmosphere but not much seating area. We got a good deal for B and B and the breakfast was great, plenty of choice. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and we enjoyed our stay there. There is a U bahn station quite close to the hotel and also several supermarkets close by. We would probably stay at the hotel again and would like to explore the area more next time as felt quite safe there

Reviews.Title: “Maybe "Minor Royalty" but never "Queen"”
Reviews.Author: BHSLarry
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located quite close to the U Bahn and most convenient. Rooms are smallish a la European style. The staff, although most pleasant, are totally unknowledgeable about the most basic questions: "Where is the closest Catholic Church?" We got directions to the closest Catholic "hospital." Where is the nearest German restaurant? "Oh, ,just walk down this or that street and you are bound to find one or two." We found Italian, Greek, Indian, but nary a German one. Do we have to validate train tickets? "Yes," was the quick reply. Of course, no such thing was necessary and I spent wasted minutes looking for the validation machine! The hotel "maps" are unreadable, and the ones that were disappeared from the supply cabinet. Breakfasts were OK, but if a tour group happened to be there early in the morning, the pickings were slim indeed. The kitchen staff seemed most relunctant to bring out food replacements. The milk was almost always close to being spoiled. I have a good measure of all this since we stayed nine days. I think I would chose hotel closer to the center of things if I ever went to Berlin again. That in itself s rather doubtful.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Zoologist78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the u-bahn which is an added bonus. The staff were all really friendly and helpful. The rooms and hotel were clean. I enjoyed the buffet breakfast, I found plenty of choices of hot and cold food, plus free newspapers each day, both in the restaurant and the lobby. Would stay here again and recommend the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: phoebe_skywalker
Reviews.Content: I was completely satisfied with every aspect of this hotel. My double room was quiet, clean and a nice size. The location is wonderful and there is a big health food shop around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “A port in a storm”
Reviews.Author: exwetherby
Reviews.Content: To be fair to the hotel, we stayed here for 1 night as part of a tour, when the tour company forgot to book a hotel - it can't have been easy accommodating 36 people at 23:00, who'd been driven around Berlin for 4 hours. Really nice barmaid who kept the bar open until 01:00 so we could at least wind down and relax for a couple of hours. Rooms were standard city style and the breakfast was nice, if you avoided the mouldy supermarket sliced bread for the toaster.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not in summer”
Reviews.Author: Balwinder_K_Dhaliwal
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was its location: it was near a train and bus stations; also near a pharmacy, sandwich shop and about 15 minutes walk to a supermarket. The only thing I didn't like was no aircon. I stayed a few nights during the World Cup 2006 and it was hot, and the lack of aircon was hard to take.

Reviews.Title: “brill base in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: oddw
Reviews.Content: We just had a break between xmas and new year 2010. Hotel is well situated for restaurants,shops and attractions i.e zoo and tiergarten. We HIGHLY RECOMMEND restaurant ROBBENGATTER its on GRUNEWALDSTRASSE 55, 10825, excellent ambience,beer food and service. Hotel is to a 3 star standard but it is clean and comfortable excellent reception ladies. Good breakfast but tiny bit limited and could be hotter. City tour tickets from reception (20 euro) each very good value for a city tour of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for one night”
Reviews.Author: rnathan
Reviews.Content: Good overall, helpful front desk. Located close to station on U9 line.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KimBlythe
Reviews.Content: Super location, nextdoor to Guenzelstrasse tube stop with easy access across the city. A ten minute walk from Kurfurstendam which is the main shopping district. Lots of restaurants, cafes, discos and bars en route into town. Staff were very helpful, parking was free, hotel provided free map so it had everything we needed for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, comfortable, quiet place to stay with pleasant helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: MrTerry
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel next to the ADAC building and really handy for the Guntzelstrasse subway, couple of stops or so from the Zoologishergartens main staion. In Berlin for a few days just get the Berlin Welcome card ticket and hop on any public transport around above or below. Consider buying it before you leave the airport : zones A-C on your ticket will save you buying a ticket to get into the centre of Berlin and might still be valid to get you back if you have enough days on it. Use your ticket (if zone C on it) to get to Potsdam. Our 72 hour Berlin Welcome Card ticket (get your money off voucher booklet with it) with zones ABC cost £25 and worth every cent. The street is a minutes walk from Greek and other restaurants. We tried the nearest (Knossos) twice because it was not dear but was good and welcoming. Hotel breakfast is fine for veggies or carnivires (scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, lots of cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, smoked salmon, cheeses etc). Room was clean and comfortable with tea/coffee, air con and drinks fridge. I would certainly go back. If you are visiting for pleasure choose a good day and go to Potsdam (fantastic). Another day take the morning Insider Berlin(Google it) walking tour (great). Boat trip on the Spray also nice of an evening. If you want some cardiovascular try the Siegesaule tower climb (£2.50) and catch views to Brandenburg Gate etc. Berlin was really something (I was not particularly fussed about going initially) and is my favourite European city so far. We had three days and packed a lot in...but not enough.

Reviews.Title: “nice & quiet”
Reviews.Author: razm
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 6 beautiful August days in Berlin. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Berlin, whether for the first time or for a return visit. The location is great, with the metro just outside and only about 15 minutes walk to Kurfurstendam. Nice and quiet neighborhood with a lot of restaurants around the hotel. From Schoenefeld airport you need around 45 min. with S9 to Zoologische Garten and then you should change to U9 for 2 more station but it worth; the location and the hotel are great! The room was clean and comfortable, not very large but enough taking account we didn’t spend a lot of time in the room; the breakfast was very substantial and the staff were very nice and helpful. I liked it very much and I'd definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK - Nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: Jurnee
Reviews.Content: This was one of the hotels I stayed in with the group I was hosting and for the price, it's satisfactory. PROS - it's located about five minutes walk from the U-Bahn and only two stops from the KuDamm. The bed is comfortable and there’s a normal working TV. CONS - no Internet (free or otherwise), no bathroom amenities (except 2 shower caps), and no Internet cafés nearby. There are restaurants when you exit the building to the right but I wouldn't exactly call it a lively neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “This just In...”
Reviews.Author: mikegreen
Reviews.Content: Just back from a pleasant stay in Berlin and a very pleasant stay at The Quuens Hotel. Check in was painless and polite (room was on the fourth floor). Room was very clean and well presented also the bathroom/shower was spotless. Beds were comfy apart from rather flacid pillows so if anybody that has any clout at Best Western is reading this... Did not avail ourselves of the 12 Euro breakfast as we thought it a little expensive so just used the cafe across the street metioned by another reviewer for coffee and croissants. Although the hotel is not in the centre (Mitte) of Berlin it is VERY easy to get around town as there is a U-Bahn (metro/tube) 100 yards or so from the front door of the hotel which if you have a Welcomecard (a tourist vistor all zone all forms of transport pass) will connect you quickly and without fuss to anywhere you need to get to. Just whatever you do do not forget to get any type of travel ticket validated by punch machine (obvious what you need to do and they are located both inside and outside all stations and some bus stops). We did and got slapped with an 80 Euro fine...doh! So get a ticket and get it stamped! It's no good otherwise. Anyway back to the hotel. Staff were without fail pleasant and helpful. Good Stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DSDurham
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at The Best Western Queens Hotel, 7 - 10 July 2006, whilst visiting Berlin for the World Cup. The hotel is situated in a nice quiet locale but with in walking distance of U9 Underground. Breakfast is buffet style and plentiful but of pretty basic fare. My biggest gripe is that there is no air conditioning in the bedrooms and in fine sunny weather the bedrooms, paricularly on the front of the hotel, become unbearably hot. I called on a couple of occasions to reception who stated that they only had a small number of fans which were in other rooms. The general demeanour of the reception staff was quite dismissive & disinterested. I will give this one a miss in future.

Reviews.Title: “nice but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: gbury
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights in Berlin. Queens Hotel is very nice, we had a large triple room, very comfortable. Great buffet breakfast. Helpful staff. Only problem is that it is not located near anything except an Ubahn station and a great organic food market. Because Berlin's train system is so excellent it was easy to get around but I would have preferred being closer to any of the main tourist areas. Berlin is a fabulous city and very easy to navigate. Queens Hotel is great if you don't mind always taking the train.

Reviews.Title: “New Best Western”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western Queens Hotel for 5 nites and I would recommend it to anyone. It has just joined the BW chain in Sept. and it is rated as a 4 star hotel. Although not right in the center of the tourist scene, it is only a short U-bahn ride to the Ku'damm (U9 - from the Ku'damm, the hotel is two stops south at Guntzelstr.) The hotel is just around the corner from the station - about a one minute walk. We liked that it was a smaller hotel. The staff was multi-lingual and very accomodating. The rooms were modest in size but had a very nice modern bathroom (we had shower only.) The area around the hotel was primarily residential but there were a number of local restaurants nearby. We didn't choose to have breakfast at the hotel (an additional 12 euros per person) so instead ate at a small bakery/cafe across the street. The nature of the neighborhood also was a benefit since we were there before the heating season and needed to have the windows open. Being a residential area, it was generally pretty quiet at night making it easier to sleep. (Hotel is on a corner. One side of hotel is on a moderately busy street = Guntzelstr. Other street side is much less busy.) We booked through the BW website - price: 75 Euros/night (not including breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: paulde
Reviews.Content: Splendid little hotel in the pleasant Wilmersdorf/Charlottenberg district. Kathe Kolwitz Musuem very close. Quite a way from the city centre but not a problem given Berlin's excellent public transport (U-Bahn just around the corner). Not all rooms have baths if you need a soak after the end of a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Berlin. The rooms are clean, staff helpful and multilingual, and the location good on a quiet street one block from an underground station. The breakfast is fantastic, and everyone found something they loved. It's a bit of a walk to the zoo and shopping, but public transport is a breeze. We would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Queens Hotel Berlin City West
